author: Jason Gay
title: Sloan News Day! What Were MIT, ESPN and Obama Hiding?
text:
Over its 12-year history, the MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference has evolved into a sort of merry Comic-Con for the growing sports analytics business. It’s a place where smart people talk about new ways to interpret the games they love - there are panel discussions, papers presented (“Bhostgusters: Realtime Interactive Play Sketching with Synthesized NBA Defenses”) and a lot of nerding out about data. Influential sports people go to Sloan, which takes its name from the Sloan School of Management, the business school at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. ESPN is the conference’s lead, presenting sponsor.
